video_description: In this video, TechHog Associate Editor, Doug, unboxes and reviews the Acer Iconia Tab w500 Windows 7 Tablet.
title: Acer Iconia Tab w500 unboxing and review

comments.text: Give me my tablet back biatch!﻿ :P
comments.author: BOS6940

comments.text:
I liked this review it was very informative but I think you spend too much time talking about the really little things like the position of the power button and where the ethernet is.
That is﻿ the kind of stuff you should just gloss over letting us know it has those features. We'll know where they are once we buy them and if we don't buy them we don't care where the plugs are.
Otherwise an enjoyable review.
comments.author: Matthew Dixon

comments.author: ilovzynek1910

comments.text:
Well, it's a normal Windows computer (32 Bit), so it can run any software you like.
Just keep in mind that the﻿ internal SSD is quite small with 32GB, so if you have a software that needs much room, you are better off with a external harddrive.
